intro: Perityle microglossa var. saxosa, commonly known as the saxicolous microglossa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky or alpine environments. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in crevices or on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, nutrient-poor conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its specialized habitat, it is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
